name: Web
description: Maintains and updates the UPE website and test bank infrastructure
Keeps track of member and candidate information
Updates the tutoring schedule every quarter

name: Advocacy
description: Assists advocacy director(s) and chair(s) in bringing about positive forward change in the CS community
Makes UPE accessible and approachable to students
Leads UPE involvement with on-campus initiatives to create changes within the CS department (e.g. CS Town Hall)
Conducts surveys to gather feedback on the needs of the CS community
Collaborates with other student-led organizations and faculty to advocate for student interests within the CS community (eg. Ethics requirement reform and other curricula reform)
Streamlines process of creating new diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives (eg. CS Welcome Day, broadening participation in computing via outreach to local high schools)

name: Design & Publicity
description: Works with the CS department to send email blasts and publicize flagship events
Coordinates with chairs and committees to chalk events in lecture halls, make announcements, etc. to keep us on top of our game!
Coordinate UPE social media accounts (e.g. Instagram @uclaupe, Facebook, LinkedIn, newsletter)
Design graphics adhering to a brand standard for use in publicization of events

name: Finance & Facilities
description: Collaborates with other UPE committees to help plan purchases (food, prizes, games) and event locations
Helps finance committee maintain contact with the CS department to handle reimbursements and other monetary matters

name: Induction & Membership
description: Designs and manages the UPE Induction, Intern, and Tutor programs
Handles communication with inductees, tutors, and interns quickly and effectively
Plans candidate orientation needs (presurvey form, room booking)
Keeps interns, tutors, and inductees checked off for various requirements
Ensures all interns, tutors and inductees satisfy their requirements and know how to satisfy their requirements
Schedules tutoring hours for inductees/tutors/interns/officers with web and tutoring chairs
Ensures inductees are completing tutoring hours

name: Mentorship
description: Helps lead 3-4 mentorship events per quarter, including but not limited to Recruitment Preparation Workshops, Summer Planning Workshops, and CS Research Panels.
Helps our fellow CS majors land jobs at their dream companies
Offers quarterly resume reviews and class planning office hours
Coordinates inductee mock interviews (booking room, scheduling officers, etc.)
Follows up with participants to further improve future events

name: Social
description: Make the year as fun as possible for all UPE members!
Ensures that all inductees complete their social requirement by providing 4-6 events per quarter
Plans officer exclusive events, like parties, fun outings, spontaneous trips, whatever fun things you can think of! The sky's the limit.
Organizes annual officer retreats (fall, spring)
Organizes annual end of the year banquet for officers (venue, dinner, senior gifts, etc.)

name: Tutoring
description: Make sure students in Computer Science classes have all the support they need
Help facilitate midterm review sessions and project hacks for lower division and upper division CS classes.
Design study guides for lower division CS classes so students can quickly review for exams

name: Corporate
description: Plans 2-4 events per quarter, such as info sessions, tech talks, and company tours, with companies.
Reaches out to recruiters/engineers to see if they would be interested in having events.
Works with Google, Meta, Citadel, Blizzard, DRW, and many others.
Works with the CS department to help attract and onboard new affiliates.

name: Alumni
description: Promotes better relationships between current and graduated UPE members.
Helps plan alumni events, including panels and quarterly alumni mixers for current students and UCLA alumni to chat and connect.
Shares UPE alumnisâ€™ perspectives with the rest of the CS community.
Comes with fresh ideas on how to better improve alumni relations.
